thread.title: Possible Amerks lines; injury update; new arena food
thread.title_full: Possible Amerks lines; injury update; new arena food

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: Possible Amerks lines; injury update; new arena food
text:
Cunneyworth said both should play Friday. The lines in practice:
Evan Rodrigues-Cal O'Reilly-Jason Akeson
Allan McPherson-Phil Varone-Nick Baptiste
Jerry D'Amigo-Matt Ellis-Jason Bailey
William Carrier/Justin Kea/Jean Dupuy/Jack Nevins
I'm assuming Catenacci slides into the left wing spot on Varone's line, since that's where he was in the preseason game on Thursday. I'm guessing Schaller moves between D'Amigo and Bailey.
* * * * * * *
Amerks players and coaches are out delivering season tickets this afternoon.
Cunneyworth rode his motorcycle to the rink for practice this morning and also took it out for his deliveries.
He rides a Yamaha Super Tenere 1200, a bike he says is great for off-rode riding as well as the streets.
His love for motorcycles began when he was a player with the Amerks in the early 1980s, and he teamed up with teammates Lou Crawford and Dirk Rueter, as well as Steve Bartlett for a few rides. Bartlett at the time owned Cycle Enterprises. He has been an agent for hockey players for the past 30 years and is president of his firm, Pittsford-based Sports Consulting Group.
What's different about riding now than then?
"I am much slower," Cunneyworth said. "I enjoy the scenery more than anything and you have to go slow to see the scenery."
* * * * * * *
Concessions at Blue Cross Arena at the Rochester Community War Memorial have a few new items.
Now on the menu:
Meatballs in a cup (three varieties; Swedish, barbecue and marinara). At Riverside Rohrbach's, behind section 106. Poutine fries (topped with cheese curds, gravy and bacon bits). At International Stand, behind section 102. Rochester fries (topped with meat hot sauce and onions). At International Stand. Grilled chicken sandwich. At Court Street Grille, behind section 128. Taco salad. At Mexican Stand, behind section 126). Chili cheese fries. At International Stand. Perry's Ice Cream. At Sweet Spot, behind section 102. * * * * * * *
The opening night "mystery" puck will feature the 60th anniversary logo.
Each is signed by a player and they'll be on sale game night.
The "mystery" puck that will be on sale at Friday's Amerks season opener. (Photo: Kevin Oklobzija)
